author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: I note that the last CI run was on Julia 0.4. Does it work on Julia 1.X?

Your `new package` pull request does not meet all of the guidelines for automatic merging.

Specifically, your pull request does not meet the following guidelines:

- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: julia

---
It is important to note that if your pull request does not meet the guidelines for automatic merging, this does not mean that your pull request will never be merged. It just means that your pull request will require manual review by a human.

> These guidelines are intended not as requirements for packages but as very conservative guidelines, which, if your new package or new version of a package meets them, it may be automatically merged.

---
[noblock]
You need to retrigger the bot to include that.

Ok, retriggered for v1.2.0, which seems now to require intervention precisely because the version is not 1.0.0 (sorry).  Somehow, I was hoping that the trigger was performed by bumping to v1.2.0 actually.
Since 1.0.0 is not released you can retrigger with that version.
Having adopted a v0.1.0 that zeptodoctor is happy with, I believe we can close.
It wouldn't hurt to delete that other v1.2.0 branch as well, thanks.
